Ken/Cesar,

I have been working on my own version of NEAT in Python, but it=
 is
still in a fairly primitive state (many bugs and some of the more
recen=
t features of NEAT have not been implemented). You are more than
welcome to=
 take a look, though:
http://code.google.com/p/pyneat/

Please let me know =
if you have any feedback.

Thanks,
Brian
